result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles A Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--To pay costs of $268 
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge

--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol  or illegal drugs
--To take all prescribed drugs as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand 

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:01 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Charles A Wood in court, in-custody, with Attorney Miguel Adolfo Michel. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #7 & #10; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #8, #11 & #12

On Count #7, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:
On Count #10, the Court withholds sentence, places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--To take all prescribed drugs as prescribed
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--To pay costs of $268 (Ct#7)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (Ct#7)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (Ct#7)
--To pay costs of $243 (Ct#10)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (Ct#10)
--To pay restitution of $388.02 payable to Grade-Tech Pavers, joint & several with Matthew Bradley
--To pay restitution of $150 payable to Reflections Jewelry, joint & several with Matthew Bradley
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee
--To reimburse $938.40 extradition fees (JESO)

Days credit for time already served: 92 days
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given
Recess: 3:19 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Motion hearing on January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions/Adjudications, State's (with cover letter)
of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant, State's

Final status/scheduling conference on January 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on December 17, 2014 at 03:40 pm.

Case called at 8:59 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Charles A Wood in court, in custody, with Attorney Miguel A. Michel. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ: Defendant has indicated that his legal name is Woods, do not have reason to doubt that, but do not have any documentation to confirm this. Orally motions to add AKA: Charles A. Woods to case. After speaking with Deputy Hrovatin, he indicated that Charles Woods is an alias sometimes used by Mr. Wood.
Court orders that Charles A. Woods be added to the complaint/case as AKA
Atty Michel files motion to dismiss

Daniel Hrovatin--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by DA Happ
--State Exh#1-No consent form-offered/received
--cross exam by Atty Michel
--redirect by DA Happ
DA Happ orally motions to AMEND criminal complaint to reflect a DOV on Count #10 as 7/15/14
Arguments by Counsel

Court finds probable cause that Mr. Wood committed a felony. Court binds him over for Arraignment.
DA Happ requests arraignment at later date
Recess: 9:37 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Arraignment 12/12/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices **ADDRESS STATES ORAL MOTION TO REFELCT DOV ON CT#10**
Scheduling Notice
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 1:29 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Charles A Wood appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Wood indicates that his last name is "Woods" not "Wood"
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Defendant qualifies for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB confirmed accurate & new address given; maximum penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds probable cause within the complaint to support Counts #7, #8 & #10
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Court requires a $2,000 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No contact with co-Defendant, Matthew Bradley
-No presence at Service Station or Pawn Shop mentioned in the complaint

Court informs parties that It will schedule preliminary hearing within 10 days
Court considers warrant satisfied & executed based upon appearance of Defendant.
Recess: 1:42 pm
